Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 16:00 27/01/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG5586'

Faults.name: BA22 & BA7 Areas

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

As offered over the weekend, our support services including food reimbursement, welfare units, warm hubs and accommodation remain on offer for you. All the information about this can be found at www.ssen.co.uk/stormsupport/.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you're struggling at all or have any medical concerns without electricity, please call us on 105 and a member of the team will be happy to help.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

As offered over the weekend, our support services including food reimbursement, welfare units, warm hubs and accommodation remain on offer for you. All the information about this can be found at www.ssen.co.uk/stormsupport/.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you're struggling at all or have any medical concerns without electricity, please call us on 105 and a member of the team will be happy to help.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

Faults.name: KA27 Area

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

Faults.name: PA20 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of an issue affecting the power for homes and businesses in this area.

Due to Storm Éowyn causing significant damage over the weekend, all our teams are very busy trying to get power back on for customers who have been off supply since Friday, Saturday or yesterday and this may mean it takes us a little longer to get a team of engineers to your area. The restoration time above is our current estimate based on the information we know, but if anything changes, we'll update this here and if you register for updates, we'll text you too.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook so one of the team can help.

Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

Faults.name: AB55 Area

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.
